bug.short_desc: Better loadtime/runtime debug infos / Application Interface Methods

long_desc.thetext:
I am currently developing a mobile application based on qooxdoo and I found that the infos of the loadtime etc. are a bit misleading or missing.
* qx.Bootstrap.LOADSTART should be infact better named qx.Bootstrap.EXECSTART as it is the moment the script engines processing the content. It does not include both, the loading time and the parsing time.
* It would be nice to have some info about these two times. Even if combined. To support this one needs a separate info in every HTML. This could automatically be used if available e.g. if (window.HTMLSTART) { qx.Bootstrap.LOADTIME = qx.Bootstrap.EXECSTART - window.HTMLSTART; }
* It would be useful to store the main/finalize runtime infos somewhere in qooxdoo.
* The "finalize" method is still a bit useless. For loading data it's not appropriate as it blocks other GUI relevant code from loading e.g. sending AJAX requests to load data here is probably a bad idea. So it's mainly an internal thing of a GUI application to control the rendering but has no usage for the native application developer. I would suggest to remove this method from the interface and from the native application classes.
* One thing one might add instead is a "load" method which might be executed with a timeout so it does not block the other stuff. We use such a method in our application to load data using AJAX with a 200ms offset. The effect is dramatically better than compared to putting that stuff into the "finalize" method. This might also help the API viewer etc. where the tree sometimes is rendered before the images are loaded.
* Not sure if main() is still a good name then, though. It would be more easy to communicate to have something like "setup" -> "ui" -> "load" which means "setup environment" => "building gui" => "loading data". This would perfectly match our requirements here. We have a setup phase which manipulates META-Tags, loads CSS styles etc., a main phase which restores the last state (e.g. parsing history data, cookies, etc.) and a load time where we send AJAX requests to the backend.
If there is interested I can cooperate these changes back into qooxdoo and providing a patch. We need to make sure that it do not break existing code, but with some deprecation things in place this might not be an issue.
